result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith Bryant Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable Court costs & surcharges; to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of funds with remaining balance to be collected during period of Extended Supervision.  Any unpaid amount to be converted to a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
*9/19/2016 Credit of four days.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

The DOC shall collect all costs and surcharges from up to 25% of prison funds, with balance to be collected during term of extended supervision.  Any unpaid balance is to be converted to a civil judgment.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one  and with any other sentence.
*9/19/2016 Credit of four days.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (28 pages) commencing 10/15/15 SENTENCING received and filed.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  jew
Box D279

Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1 AND CONCURRENT TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
As to all costs and surcharges, the DOC shall collect up to 25% of prisons funds. Remaining balance to be collected during period of extended supervision. Any unpaid amount to be converted to a civil judgment. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Counsel to submit sentence credit form in the event that credit is not applied to pending revocation matter.  

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Letter from the defendant received and filed.
- filed.
/stipulation and order for return/destruction of exhibits, signed and filed.

Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 9:45am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Walls and Pawlak who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 11:58am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to both counts which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for aquittal not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.
COURT ORDERS DEFENDANT REMANDED PENDING SENTENCING.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Same appearances. Testomony of James E. continues.  Sworn for the state: Taisha C., MPD Detective Scott Lackovic. Exhibits 34, 39-43 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Defendant.  Exhibits 37, 38 Received. Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Court instructed jury.  Trial to continue on 9/25/15 at 8:30am in Br. 35.

Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state. Defense reserves right to make opening statement. Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Detective Calros Rutherford, James E. Exhibits 1-14,16-18,20,21-32,33,35,36 received. Trial to continue after the lunch hour.

Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court places trial orders on the record.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 2:30pm. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Jury trial to continue on 9/24/15 at 9:00am in br. 35.

Matter is recalled. Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has previously entered speedy trial demand. Matter remains scheduled for trial on 9/23/15 at 9:30am in br. 35.

Antonella Aleman for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court grants stipulation for substitution of counsel. Attorney Moczydlowski is withdrawn as counsel of record forthwith. Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #10CF4260 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Scott Lackovic-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: James E.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  
Defendant Keith Bryant Anderson in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court enters a plea of Not Guilty as to Count 2 on behalf of the defendant.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
